thread.title: Football: Mistakes cost Siloam in loss to Catholic
thread.title_full: Football: Mistakes cost Siloam in loss to Catholic

title: Football: Mistakes cost Siloam in loss to Catholic
text:
Football: Mistakes cost Siloam in loss to Catholic By Graham Thomas Posted: October 17, 2015 at 1 a.m. 
SILOAM SPRINGS -- An offsides penalty on the opening kickoff of the game proved to be a bad omen for Siloam Springs on Friday night. 
Not much went the Panthers' way after that in a 31-21 loss to Little Rock Catholic in a 7A/6A-Central Conference game at Panther Stadium. 
How They Scored 
Little Rock Catholic 31, Siloam Springs 21 
LR Catholic^10^14^0^7^—^31 
Siloam Springs^0^7^7^7^—^21 
First Quarter 
LR Catholic — Temple 31 pass from Sale (Elser kick), 11:07. 
LR Catholic — FG Elser 28, 2:22. 
Second Quarter 
Siloam Springs — Hughes 5 run (Umana kick), 11:56. 
LR Catholic — Harville-Thomas 10 run (Elser kick), 9:09. 
LR Catholic — Harville-Thomas 16 pass from Sale (Elser kick), 0:22. 
Third Quarter 
Siloam Springs — Armstrong 3 pass from Norberg (Umana kick), 2:59 
Fourth Quarter 
LR Catholic — Temple 31 pass from Sale (Elser kick), 10:35 
Siloam Springs — Hughes 15 pass from Norberg (Umana kick), 2:22 
After the Panthers (4-3, 1-3) were flagged on the opening kick, Catholic senior running back Lance Harville-Thomas returned the re-kick 59 yards to the Siloam Springs' 35. Two plays later Catholic quarterback Andre Sale hit Justin Temple in the flat and Temple broke a tackle and ran 31 yards for a touchdown as the Rockets took a 7-0 lead just 53 seconds into the game. 
"We go out there and we're offsides on the opening kickoff," said Siloam Springs coach Bryan Ross. "Then we give up a big run and missed a tackle, and before the game is a minute old it's 7-0. You don't know why. That's part of the game. If we knew why we'd keep it from happening." 
It was a lead Catholic (3-4, 2-2) wouldn't relinquish. 
Harville-Thomas would go on to rush 25 times for 151 yards. He rushed for a 10-yard touchdown in the second quarter. Later in the second, he hauled in a 16-yard touchdown pass from Sale as Catholic pulled ahead 24-7 at halftime. 
Siloam Springs pulled within 24-14 in the third quarter, but Catholic answered in the fourth when Sale threw a back-shoulder 31-yard touchdown pass to Temple as the Rockets went ahead 31-14. 
Sale went on to complete 9 of 18 passes for 151 yards and three touchdowns. Catholic finished with 345 yards of offense. 
"They're pretty good defensively," said Catholic coach John Fogleman. "The kids played hard. We don't have the points to show for it, but we did OK in the second half. We had a short field a couple of times and turned it over on downs, but we did OK." 
Catholic also overcame 14 penalties for 131 yards and the loss of senior receiver Zach Gee, who was carted off the field with a leg injury in the first half. 
Siloam Springs, meanwhile, was penalized 11 times for 100 yards. Some of those penalties were costly, too. 
The Panthers were flagged for roughing the punter late in the first half, extending a Catholic drive which resulted in a touchdown. 
Coby Roach ran the second-half kickoff back 96 yards for a score but that play also came back because of a flag. 
"More of the same," Ross said. "It's pretty frustrating. I don't know what the answer is. Obviously the kids don't mean to, but you can't win football games when you make that many mistakes. We've made our share of them this year. We've just got to keep working and keep trying to teach. That's all you can do." 
The Panthers had 304 yards of offense. Catholic limited Siloam Springs running back Ricky Hughes to just 65 yards on 12 carries. Hughes also lost a fumble on a pass play. Siloam Springs quarterback Jordan Norberg was 18 of 34 for 174 yards and two interceptions.
